title: 109_s1936
content: The Act may be cited as the "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" and includes a temporary flood insurance buy-in program. The "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" provides flood insurance coverage for eligible structures affected by Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita. Coverage is limited to damage from flooding and excludes contents. The coverage amount is capped by the national flood insurance program limits. The "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" provides coverage for eligible structures damaged by flooding from Hurricane Katrina or Rita. Eligible structures must have had coverage for wind losses as of August 29, 2005, under the national flood insurance program. The "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" provides coverage for eligible structures damaged by flooding from Hurricane Katrina or Rita. Eligible structures must have had coverage for wind losses as of August 29, 2005, and for flooding from Hurricane Rita as of September 23, 2005. The Director shall charge premiums equal to 105 percent of the aggregate amount for coverage under this section. Structures must not be in special flood hazard areas and must not have had flood insurance at the time of damage. The "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" provides coverage for eligible structures damaged by flooding from Hurricane Katrina or Rita. Premiums charged for coverage under this section are equal to 105 percent of the aggregate amount that would have been charged for coverage under the national flood insurance program for the 10-year period ending on the date of purchase. Purchasers can deduct premiums from claims payable under the coverage. Any premiums collected are credited to the National Flood Insurance Fund. Claims for damage or loss under the coverage provided by the "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" can only be paid from amounts appropriated under subsection (i). Amounts in the National Flood Insurance Fund cannot be used for these claims. The "Hurricanes Katrina and Rita Flood Insurance Buy-In Act of 2005" prohibits using National Flood Insurance Fund amounts for claims under the coverage. The Director must ensure that owners of eligible structures maintain coverage under the national flood insurance program in perpetuity. The Director must determine the value of the structure or the maximum coverage limit under the national flood insurance program. They must also accept offers for mitigation actions under specific mitigation programs. When establishing rates for flood insurance coverage, the Director cannot consider premiums charged under subsection (d) or claims paid for coverage. For purposes of this section, a "covered disaster area" refers to an area where a major disaster was declared due to Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita in 2005, and flood insurance coverage was available under the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968. The "Director" is defined as the Director of. The Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency is authorized to appropriate funds for flood insurance coverage and mitigation assistance under the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968. Public notice must be issued within 30 days of enactment, outlining procedures for applying for flood insurance. The Director cannot enter into any coverage contracts without an application submitted within 90 days of the public notice.
